job_title: Clinical Pharmacist in Johnson City, TN
pros: Teams, meetings, rounding, residency/student experiential rotations, paid time off comparable, POE systems, updated hospital policies, drug trial medications, ability to publish with physicians, multiple pharmacy informatics systems, and encouraged for further development.
cons: Poor management, multiple layers of clinical pharmacy practice (competing and risk environment with multiple pharmacists from local university, clinical pharmacist specialist, clinical pharmacist, and staff pharmacist covering the same patients), limited information communicated among the multiple layers of a clinical pharmacist, hospital clinical pharmacist and university college of pharmacy clinical pharmacist complicate patient care, administration focus on business instead of patients, workplace bullying present, reduced staff, increased healthcare professional and patient ratios, high risk of errors due to work environments, multiple pharmacy informatics systems, encouraged further development with limited ability to grow, high turn over hidden under retaining staff under prn positions, university college of pharmacy clinical pharmacist not employed under health-system, and much more.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Johnson City, TN
pros: Well….,,it pays the bills, so that’s a plus.
cons: Too numerous to count. Nurses are worked to death. Not fair with regard to compensation—nurses given more money to work the big hospitals, leaving the smaller hospitals in a terrible bind re:staffing. EDs are totally unsafe. Yet, every month, there are more and more promotions on the executive side. So many directors and Vice Presidents of this, that and the other. But now, we are going to eliminate travelers. Let’s not do what can be done to alleviate the staffing issues. Ridiculous.

review_title: Poor pay, understaffed, a lot expected of you
job_title: Security Officer in Abingdon, VA
pros: The schedule is decent but all shifts are 12.5 hours.
cons: Ballad Health suffers staffing issues across the board due to poor uncompetitive pay. As a security officer they were so understaffed you could not use your earned vacation. You will be started at no more than $16 per hour have to work 12.5 hours days. They charge you for a lunch break which is in violation of federal law as you work by yourself and never receive a "bona fide" lunch break as law requires. You must work through your lunch and answer calls. They just recently started having you pay $550 out of pocket for your training that they will reimburse but they do not tell you this upon hiring. They also do not tell you at hiring that if your wife works and if health insurance is offered at her work even if it is twice as expensive she cannot go on your plan.. For $16 per hour they expect a high level of professionalism, you will get kicked, punched, spit at swore at by patients there seems to be very little support for officers, you will be micromanaged by corporate staff via video systems. After about 5 months I had enough I was unable to use any of my earned vacation time during my service, they would not allow me to work out a 3 week notice and use up my vacation time on the third week and would not reimburse for vacation either. So they kept over $1000 of my earned time. Do yourself a favor and do not apply to this position it is nothing but a headache and you can do much better just about anywhere else. They are a legalized monopoly that do not pay a living wage to most employees a majority of the payroll pays exorbitant salaries to the numerous executives. Without much effort I found a job paying considerably more $ with better medical benefits at lower cost and hiring bonuses.

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Kingsport, TN
pros: PTO, HSA card with insurance, great co-workers! The immediate management I have got to work with is great with scheduling and very kind! I have learned a lot in my job position!
cons: Very poor pay for x-Ray technologists, no hazard pay for COVID although we do chest xrays on every possible covid pt as well as suspected covid patients. Also have a covid tent where we do testing no matter rain, snow or hail. Yet we don’t “deserve” hazard pay for it. Once again, hourly pay/salary for xray in ballad is terrible. Also, no incentive to get certified in other modalities. You get NO pay increase at all for it. So what’s the point? Lastly, yearly raises are 1%. A whole year of working hard and growing, and you get maybe 20 cents or so increase to show for it.

job_title: Physician Office Assistant in Johnson City, TN
pros: Helping the community.  Helping the patients.
cons:
Poor wages. No communication. Anywhere. Ever.  An occasional email 5 minutes before the news announces stories on it. Non existent raises [literally... $0.05 one year, nothing the next,  my highest raise in almost 8 years was $.21. By comparison,  Targets raise that same year was between $0.75-$2.25- for non- health related retail... right now Target pays $4 / hour more then many tenured employees in healthcare.  Terrible insurance. No HR support after the merger.. 

I work a full 80 hours and my single child and I both still qualify for Medicaid & food stamps,  and 100% write off with ballads own financial aid program.  I'm considered in poverty by their own guidelines,  and government guidelines,  and work A SECOND JOB to make the bills.  That's not ok.  I've written emails  many times, no response. Tried to get the news involved, their being paid to sway their opinions.. just wow.

review_title: Layoffs,Forcing RNs, LPNs to take 20 to 30% pays cut. But Executives Get Bonus?
job_title: Registered Nurse in Bristol, VA
pros: None. The merger destroyed a competitive business options. The FTC has allowed a Monopoly to poorly serve our communities within 100mile range.
cons:
The forced "merger" is actually à hostile takeover by Mountains States. Forcing nursing staff to accept pay cuts , benefit losses by May 24th or be forced to leave. Many left. Also, the other method used by Managers is any excuse for writing warnings to "force a being terminated for cause" for higher paid workers near retirement " is also a tool to cut jobs and not worry about retirement pensions.  They are providing hiring in fresh graduate nursing staff at lower pay and dumping the higher paid staff that have been their for 5 to 30years. 
Car Dealerships treat their well trained, long term staff much better. 
Your automobile is getting much better care than any patient at Ballad

review_title: Long hours, low pay, no lunch breaks. It's all about keeping managers happy and patients happy. Employees don't matter.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Greeneville, TN

Managers stalk your Facebook page during work hours to see if you are saying anything bad about them or their friends.
